Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Esculentin-2 HYba2 (natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; XXA; XXU, 1S=S, UCSS1a)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (91.89%) toEsculentin-2 HYba1GRAVY: 0.2; Mol formula: C168H287N45O48S3; M. Wt:   3814.579, and Mol ex coeff.: 1615 (cys-paired). <Activity: C-terminal amidated form: active against Gram+ S. aureus MTCC 9542 or MRSA ATCC 43300 (MIC 1.5-3 uM), B. subtilis MTCC 14416 (MIC 15 uM), B. coagulans ATCC 7050 (MIC 10 uM),  VRE ATCC 29212 (MIC 12 uM), S. mutans MTCC 497 (MIC 5 uM), S.  gordonnii MTCC 2695 (MIC 5 uM), Gram- V. cholerae MCV09 (MIC 7 uM), E. coli ATCC 25922 (MIC 10 uM), fish pathogens A. hydrophilia (MIC 20 uM), A. sobria (MIC 3 uM). Toxic to cancer cells Hep3B.Toxicity:  human red blood cells (human RBC): The peptide is highly hemolytic with HC50=10-12 uM (amidated or not).SAR: C-terminal amidation enhanced bacterial killing but not hemolysis. Provided by Sanil George. Reg. 11/2021
Literature Information.Author: Vineeth Kumar T, Asha R, George S.2021
Literature Information.Title: Identification and functional characterisation of Esculentin-2 HYba peptides and their C-terminally amidated analogs from the skin secretion of an endemic frog.
